content.html_value: Teaching person isn't about presenting something to be memorized. To support overall people, this page will provide games and texts designed to encourage people to explore and discover the world around them.

value.name: Our sides are equal
value.desc: In this first text, we show for people their body symmetry.

value.name: Couting
value.desc: We introduce the idea of counting using our body.

value.name: Beyond fingers
value.desc: Exploring the limitations and the necessity of new tools to count.

value.name: Drawing to count
value.desc: Exploring how indigenous peoples developed methods for counting.

value.name: Our current numbers
value.desc: Here are the numbers we use today.

value.name: Translation game
value.desc: Explore numbers from different cultures through an engaging translation game.

value.name: Memory game
value.desc: Enhance your understanding of number sequences with our interactive memory game.

value.name: Overcoming limits
value.desc: We began studying how different numerical systems represent large numbers.

value.name: Numerical families (Part I)
value.desc: To aid in the understanding of numerical sequences, we present a logic that associates numbers with specific families.

value.name: Change of direction (Part I)
value.desc: We study the logic behind the different approach used by indigenous communities as their numbers grow..

value.name: Sequence game (Part I)
value.desc: In this game, we reinforce recent lessons by completing numerical sequences.

value.name: Numerical families (Part II)
value.desc: We continue exploring our family generations and their connection to numbers.

value.name: Change of direction (Part II)
value.desc: Building on the previous discussion, this section explores how indigenous peoples represent large numbers.

value.name: Sequence game (Part II)
value.desc: In this game, the sequences are present until the billion order.

value.name: Natural limits
value.desc: In this text, we explore various natural limits and explain how mathematics is used to describe them.

content.html_value: Chapter 2: To be or not to be...

value.name: On Equality
value.desc: In this text, we begin exploring the concept of comparison and the methods for grouping identical objects.

value.name: Equality Levels
value.desc: Some concepts, like the definition of a planet, change over time. Sometimes, objects with slightly different sizes can be considered equal. How can we use numbers to quantify equality?

value.name: Are we truly equal?
value.desc: In this text, we explore the acceptable limits of inequality and emphasize that within our species, there are no races.

value.name: Bigger or Smaller
value.desc: Concluding the comparisons, we analyze the relationship between objects by classifying them as bigger or smaller.

value.name: Walking Among the Numbers
value.desc: In this text, we explore the relationships between integers.

value.name: Running Among the Numbers
value.desc: In this text, we continue exploring the relationship between integer numbers, drawing an analogy to the human body.

value.name: Yupana (Addition)
value.desc: We teach how to use the <i>'Yupana Inka Tawa Pukllay' method to perform addition operations.

value.name: Does addition always give the same result?
value.desc: Adding numbers can't always be compared to walking. In this text, we'll explore addition of numbers in more detail.

value.name: Adding the same numbers
value.desc: Some math operations repeat themselves—what’s so special about that?

value.name: Inversion
value.desc: In life, some experiences yield entirely different outcomes depending on the path we take. Does the same apply to multiplication?

value.name: Yupana (multiplication)
value.desc: We teach how to use the <i>'Yupana Inka Tawa Pukllay' method to perform multiplication operations.

value.name: Understanding the Multiplication Table (0 and 1)
value.desc: Many times, the multiplication table is presented as something to be memorized — but, why should we ignore the knowledge that comes with it?

value.name: Understanding the Multiplication Table (2 and 3)
value.desc: In this text, we explore the relationship between multiplication and nature.
